fullText: The revival of Spring Awakening at the Brooks Atkinson Theatre is both faithful to the original and radically reimagined, with deaf and hearing actors performing together in a production that feels both intimate and universal.
dtliExcerpt: The revival of Spring Awakening at the Brooks Atkinson Theatre is both faithful to the original and radically reimagined, with deaf and hearing actors performing together in a production that feels both intimate and universal.
bwwExcerpt: Occasionally - and Deaf West Theatre's production of Spring Awakening is a superb example - something latent in the material meets the mood of the time to make a revival not just a necessity but a great pleasure... This revival would have been unjustifiable were it not for the brilliant idea of placing the story in the context of deafness and using many deaf actors to tell it.
